MouseEventMovementY.summary:
The movementY read-only property of the interface provides the difference in the Y coordinate of the mouse pointer between the given event and the previous event.
In other words, the value of the property is computed like this: currentEvent.movementY = currentEvent.screenY - previousEvent.screenY.

blockquote.para: Browsers use different units for movementY and than what the specification defines. Depending on the browser and operating system, the movementY units may be a physical pixel, a logical pixel, or a CSS pixel. You may want to avoid the movement properties, and instead calculate the delta between the current client values (, ) and the previous client values.

MouseEventMovementY.value: A number. Always zero on any other than mousemove.
